Description: Aluminum can be refined into Aluminum Alloy, which is used in the prototyping process for items.
Aluminum Alloy can be used to produce Item Prototypes at the Engineering Center.
Warden specialists require a uniform designed to optimize their capacity to haul a variety of heavy ammunition.
A heavily reinforced vest designed to protect grenadiers from back blasts. As such, the Flak Vest reduces cuts and scrapes on top of dampening bullet impacts.

Repurposed from ancient wars, these armour plates are highly effective at stopping enemy small arms fire. That protection comes at the cost of weight, and the wearer will feel quite restricted and encumbered.
Standard ammunition for Storm Rifles and Armoured Cars.
A titanic light machine gun capable of scattering infantry lines with ease, the Catara is a modern weapon for the modern Colonial.
This unique assault rifle includes a high-capacity drum magazine designed for sustained rapid fire.
The Booker is a high-impact three-round burst Storm Rifle for those who like to shoot first.
Widely considered to be the first storm rifle, the Aalto is a marvel in Caoivish engineering. With its two fire modes, it can be used as a rapid-fire assault weapon or a mid-range rifle.
Standard shell for anti-tank weapons.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

Description: An explosive flask used for melting enemy armour. This carefully designed liquid bomb explodes into a dazzling flash of molten debris upon impact.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
High chance of disabling Track subsystem
Deals damage to vehicle armour

Description: A heavy anti-tank shell.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles
Higher base chance to disable vehicle subsystems

Description: A compact anti-tank grenade that can be fired from rifle grenade launcher attachments or grenade turrets. Its dense payload excels at crippling armoured vehicles while being versatile and easy to transport.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
High chance of disabling Track subsystem
Deals damage to vehicle armour

Description: Standard ammunition for anti-tank rifles.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Suppresses enemy vehicles

Description: While the Satterley is designed to be operated by a single infantryman, it remains a cumbersome rifle due to its heavy kickback and burst fire configuration. This heavy burst rifle is best suited for small squads to blindside enemy armour, stripping steel with ease, but its cumbersome setup makes it less than ideal for infantry skirmishes.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Suppresses enemy vehicles

Description: A variant of the Booker Storm Rifle, the Greyhound boasts a larger overall receiver and barrel to accommodate the increased stopping power of anti-tank rounds. Its longer, bulkier barrel allows for increased range. As a heavier automatic rifle, the Greyhound remains an excellent tool for those who’d prefer to shoot before asking questions.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Suppresses enemy vehicles

Description: A three-round burst anti-tank rifle with a high-capacity magazine. Built from a modified “Dusk” assault rifle, the receiver has been altered to support top-loaded drum magazines for better stability and efficient loading to account for its more cumbersome design and higher calibre rounds.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Suppresses enemy vehicles

Description: A deadly, long-range sniper rifle with exceptional stopping power. The “Quickhatch” is a gluttonous firearm that hungers for enemy armour and flesh alike.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Suppresses enemy vehicles

Description: This mounted anti-tank rifle boasts improved accuracy over its free-standing counterparts. The Typhon was specifically designed with shock absorption in mind, allowing for faster, more consistent firing patterns.
The Neville is unmatched in its versatility as a portable, magazine-based anti-armour firearm.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Suppresses enemy vehicles

Description: An armour piercing projectile used with specialized RPG launchers.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

Description: The Venom RPG launcher fires anti-tank charges. Its simple design makes it easy to deploy, even in high-stakes operations.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

Description: This shoulder-mounted heavy launcher is the first of its kind. It features heavy blast shielding and is capable of launching anti-tank charges over relatively large distances.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

Description: An armour piercing projectile used with indirect RPG launchers.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles.
Additional 100% chance to penetrate armoured vehicles.

Description: This single-use rocket can be fired a short distance. Designed to punch holes into tanks, the Ignifist is the perfect tool for infantry anticipating armoured resistance.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

Description: This variant of the Bonesaw MK.3 is specially designed for use with tripod mounts. This affords it with increased stability and maximum potential range.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles.
Additional 100% chance to penetrate armoured vehicles.

Description: The pride of the Warden anti-armour arsenal, the Bonesaw MK.3 has one job: to cut through the heavy metal plating of Colonial tanks.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles.
Additional 100% chance to penetrate armoured vehicles.

Description: Used to stem bleeding.
Used to construct Barbed Wire defenses.
Standard payload for battle tanks.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: High chance to penetrate armoured vehicles

Description: Attached to the barrel of a rifle, this short blade can spear enemies in close quarters encounters.
An optical instrument used for viewing distant objects.
A blood component used to treat wounded soldiers on the battlefield.
Supplies for maintaining structures. Store at Bases to prevent decay on surrounding Bunker/Trench structures when Garrison Supplies are not available.
Resource used for building basic structures and producing items.
Chunks of raw Coal that can be refined into materials needed for production and power generation at Facilities.
Components that can be salvaged into Refined Materials at a Refinery
A concrete compound that is used to build heavily fortified structures.
A portable device that mixes various materials to form Concrete, which are used to build heavily fortified structures.
Copper can be refined into Copper Alloy, which is used in the prototyping process for vehicles.
Copper Alloy can be used to produce Vehicle Prototypes at the Engineering Center.
A soldier that has been critically wounded on the battlefield. Deliver this soldier to a Hospital to recover Soldier Supplies.
An explosive charge that detonates at a target depth. This anti-submarine ordnance is fired from the deck of naval vessels using specialized launchers.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
Reduced damage against Trenches
Increased damage against Field Structures

Description: Common fuel used to power all vehicles and resource mines.
A defensive emplacement with a 68mm Anti-tank cannon. This rudimentary weapon was once built to fit onto the hull of large naval vessels, but was eventually phased out and repurposed.
This heavy artillery cannon is designed to cripple enemy fortifications from an entrenched position. Its long heavy barrel gives the "Thunderbolt" outstanding range.
A heavy cannon designed to shatter the garrisons and fortifications of advancing forces. The Exalt is best utilized when emplaced into a defensive position to take advantage of its impressive range.

To combat Caoivish ingenuity, the Meseans developed their own indirect RPG propulsion system. Dual launchers are fitted on a large emplacement platform to maximize coverage in an established position, rather than being relegated to a guerrilla warfare tool.

Built like a saw blade, the DAE 1b-2 emplacement gun is fitted with three cascading machine gun turrets. What the "Serra" lacks in power, it makes up for in sheer rate of fire for a weapon of its size.
The Snare Trap is a repurposed anti-aircraft flak cannon used to fortify emplaced positions with twin anti-infantry machine guns.
A light artillery cannon designed to be a fixture in defensive fortifications. The Lariat sports a formidable long-range 120mm cannon designed to put immense pressure on enemy infantry.
Engineers are the bones of the Mesean Republic. They are outfitted with a heavy bag and belts for easy access to tools and handheld materials.
Caoivish engineers are legendary in song and stature. They wear specialized uniforms, outfitted with belts and bags for easy access to tools and handheld materials.
Resource used for producing explosive weapons.

This unique demolition tool is a long, metal tube packed with explosives. The Hydra’s Whisper is designed to destroy out-of-reach movement impairing structures and detonate any mines along the length of the tube.

A high-powered explosive charge that requires an accompanying detonator. The Havoc Charge is highly effective at demolishing large structures. The charge must be detonated via gunshot. The Havoc Charge’s true potential is unleashed when executing strategic demolitions at safe distances.
Refined Coal required for various Facility processes.
Damaged Components that can be salvaged into Components.
Metal beams needed to produce basic structures and vehicles at Facilities.
A reinforced barrel of extremely explosive substances required for the deadliest warheads.
Heat-absorbant metal shielding that protects even the most volatile materials from the elements, preventing unwanted explosions.
Refined metal bars needed to produce advanced structures and vehicles at Facilities.
Shaped, steel beams required for the most advanced processes at Facilities.
Specialized metal sheets forged using Coal that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.
Specialized metallic bars fortified with Petrol that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.
Sulfur-enriched metallic bars that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.
High-end steel bars, fortified with Heavy Oil that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.
Meticulously engineered alloy beams that are required to assemble advanced vehicles and equipment.
Bars of incredibly rare materials used in some of the most advanced and complex constructions, such as large naval vessels and AEON Rockets.
A high grade fuel that's refined from Oil. Used in a variety of applications at Facilities.
Oil that has been purified and enriched for advanced Facilities processes.
Standard ammunition for Field Machine Guns and Gunboats.
Standard calibre rocket with an incendiary explosion. Will ignite objects near impact.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Deals High Explosive damage on impact

Description: Used by medics to heal other soldiers.
A drum containing fuel for use with flame weapons.
Ammo for “Molten Wind” v.II Flame Torch
Ammo for Willow’s Bane Model 845

Using a deadly mix of flammable gasses and chemical compounds, the “Molten Wind” is the Colonial Legion’s most devastating infantry weapon. Employing ancient techniques, Mesean chemists developed a technique to stabilize and weaponize liquid flames, which quickly transform any flammable structure into a raging inferno.

Named for the unfortunate trees harmed in the development of this highly destructive weapon, the Willow’s Bane utilizes flammable chemicals and fires them into a concentrated stream through an open flame. This liquid flame ignites Colonial emplacements and garrisons to route infantry while reducing their defenses to a pile of ash.
Protects against poison gas
When attached to a Gas Mask, this filter provides fresh air to the wearer.
Green Ash is an asphyxiating toxin. Inhaling it without protection will result in a quick death. Be sure to wear a gas mask with fresh filters when handling Green Ash.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Causes damage over time

Description: A rifle attachment that fires grenades with pneumatic force. Along with specialized grenades, it can launch standard grenades.
The Bomastone is a ‘stick’ style fragmentation grenade with a handle designed to aid in lobbing over moderate distances.

A weapon designed to launch specialty grenades over long-distances.  This modern Kraunian firearm uses advanced propulsion designed for increased efficiency due to the overall weight of the weapon and projectiles.
Capable of firing different grenades, quickly and at long range, the Fissura gd.I is mobile enough for easy transport, while increasing the effectiveness of infantry ordinance.
Of the most distinguished divisions of the Legion are the Grenadiers. They are outfitted with specialized satchels and pockets for maximizing their capacity to haul explosives.

This anti-personnel fragmentation grenade is designed with pull-pin mechanics and a timed fuse for user safety. Serrations in the casing allow for a better grip and increased fragmentation effectiveness.
Resource used for building Roads and Foundations.
Payload for heavy artillery weapons.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
Reduced damage against Trenches
Increased damage against Field Structures

Description: Resource used for producing heavy explosive weapons.
This densely packed, high-explosive grenade is designed to damage structures and vehicles.
An explosive Estrellan grenade specially designed for use with handheld grenade launchers. This modern grenade boasts a larger payload and is deadly to lingering infantry and structural supports.
Standard calibre rocket with a heavy explosive payload. Chance to ignite objects near impact.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Deals High Explosive damage on impact

Description: Anti-infantry mine that deliver a fatal payload to unsuspecting soldiers.
Iron can be refined into Iron Alloy, which is used in the prototyping process for vehicles.
Iron Alloy can be used to produce Vehicle Prototypes at the Engineering Center.
This heavy infantry cannon requires a tripod for stability. The Daucus is designed to give infantry a foothold against enemy vehicles and light fortifications or established fortified garrisons.
Payload for light artillery weapons.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
Reduced damage against Trenches
Increased damage against Field Structures

Description: Standard payload for small cannons.
A container for storing high volumes of liquids. Nearby structures and vehicles can refill directly from this container.
A device used to intercept enemy radio broadcasts transmitted from nearby sources.
Standard payload used with Storm Cannons.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
Reduced damage against Trenches
Increased damage against Field Structures

Description: A heavy mace constructed from solid wood and dotted with lead rivets. Commonly used when raiding entrenched positions in close quarters where firearms are less effective and an old-fashioned bludgeoning is better suited for the job.
Supplies for maintaining structures. Store at Bases or Maintenance Tunnels to prevent decay on surrounding structures.
A material pallet.
For medics of the Legion, this uniform has a plethora of pockets and bags designed to carry and deploy first aid gear easily.
Physicians in the Warden army are unmatched and this uniform has a plethora of pockets and bags designed to carry and deploy first aid gear easily.
Salvage that can be recycled into other resources at a Refinery
Used to construct Metal Beam defenses.
Standard ammunition for machine guns.
The Gast is a deadly but cumbersome Kraunian heavy machine gun. It is best suited to holding and defending established fortifications or garrisoned structures against encroaching infantry.

Built on the bones of the first automatic weapons introduced to the Legion, the “Lamentum” mm.IV is still quite an intimidating force to encounter on the battlefield. Boasting a large magazine and impressive active range, this mounted machinegun excels at laying down consistent suppressive fire.

Early iterations of this machinegun were built to be emplaced in bunkers and on the decks of lightly armed warships, the Ratcatcher is Harvey Malone’s first freely mountable infantry weapon designed for field use. Just like its predecessors, this heavy weapon suppresses enemy soldiers with unmatched efficiency.
This heavy machine gun is bulky enough to require a steady surface to maintain stability. The Malone series of machine guns are unmatched defenders on the battlefield.
Standard explosive shell used with certain small vehicles and infantry weapons.
This short-range cannon is designed to bombard enemy infantry with indirect fire.
An explosive payload used with mortar tubes.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
Reduced damage against Trenches
Increased damage against Field Structures

Description: A long-burning flare that ignites midair to illuminate a large area and reveals enemy targets.
An incendiary payload used with mortar tubes. Will ignite objects near impact.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Deals High Explosive damage on impact

Description: An payload filled with shrapnel used with mortar tubes. Devastates nearby infantry.
A shell that is launched over short distances by a spigot mortar.

This uniform, while impractical in combat, denotes the head of a regiment. Appropriately dressed officers may freely discipline their subordinates. Ancient Mesean officialis were key to the Legion’s organization. This modern attire honours their lasting legacy.

A formal uniform that denotes a regiment’s leading officer. While impractical, the officer on duty may use their authority to discipline subordinates without reparation. Officers hold an important role in the Warden military, dating back to ancient times when Caoiva was ruled by a dozen kings.
A raw viscous liquid that must be refined into fuel at Facilities.
A medium grade fuel that's refined from Oil. Used as a higher end fuel for vehicles and in various applications at Facilities.
Used to construct various types of pipelines for transporting liquids.
Standard ammunition for pistols.
A pistol imported from Estrella in the east, the Ferro 879 is a common sight on many battlefields.

This unique sidearm fires in three-round bursts. The Cascadier may not have the stopping power of its cousins, but it more than makes up for it with its lightweight frame, concealability and fire rate.
Standard issue Warden pistol. Designed by a Nevish gunsmith, the Ahti Model 2 is a reliable sidearm that any soldier should feel proud to carry.
Receives map intelligence updates
Automatically gathers map intel periodically when equipped.
Quite accustomed to the temperate climates of the south, Colonials wear this oilcloth jacket paired with thick boots to operate at high efficiency in all but the heaviest storms.
A compound of extremely rare metals used in the production of the most advanced vehicles and weapons.
Vehicle parts used to assemble Relic vehicles.
A container that can carry large quantities of resources and can be transported by certain vehicles.
The Cometa T2-9 boasts remarkable stopping power for a sidearm. This Estrellan mainstay has lived through several generations due to its fine craftsmanship and design.
Standard ammunition for revolvers.
Standard ammunition for rifles.

An auto-firing rifle that played a pivotal role in maintaining Mesean interests on the Katoman continent. While not quite as rapid-firing as its assault rifle brethren, many soldiers speak fondly of the Catena as a sturdy, easy-to-use, and reliable firearm. It doesn’t boast high points in any particular area but performs admirably as a general-purpose rifle.

The precursor to the storm rifle, the Sampo Auto-Rifle, is a mastercraft of its day. With a single shot and automatic fire mode, this versatile rifle may not reach the fire rates of automatic weapons but more than makes up for it with utility.

The primary infantry rifle of the Colonial Legion. Its predecessor, The Volta Repeater, was a sturdy, reliable firearm but had many limitations, namely, fire rate. The Argenti solves this limitation as well as being more compact and lightweight.

An old war Mesean rifle. It boasts high stopping power, but not as accurate as its modern variant. A weapon of legend, the Howling Lions wielded the Volta during their raid on the beaches of Fisherman’s Row.
The weapon of choice for pirates and smugglers, its legend is well-earned. With incredibly high stopping power and unique revolver mechanism, the Hangman often plays judge, jury, and executioner.
This unique rifle fires three rounds in rapid succession. The Fuscina is the first of its kind, designed for laying down suppressive fire during assaults on fortified enemy entrenchments.

The Blakerow is a carbine with a high rate of fire compared to its bolt-action predecessor. This increased fire rate does come at the cost of innate stopping power; however, its versatility and lightweight frame more than make up for any perceived shortcomings.
An older but reliable model of Kraunian long rifle. The Omen is a sturdy, simple weapon best used in long-distance skirmishes.
The Clancy Cinder is a classic, high-powered long rifle designed for use in mid-to-long range encounters. First deployed with the Hands during a high-risk operation in Acrithia.

Initially a field-modified Loughcaster, the Hawthorne sports a sawed-off barrel and a much lower profile than its ancestor. While sacrificing accuracy, its lightweight frame opens up the Hawthorne to a much higher degree of flexibility in battle and can be carried alongside a heavier primary firearm.
Standard-issue Warden rifle. This bolt-action firearm is as robust as they come and has seen over a century of use on the battlefield.
A fast-moving explosive projectile used with RPG launchers.

This unique dual-barrelled RPG launcher can fire two RPG shells in relatively quick succession. This increase in firepower makes it nearly impossible for a single soldier to operate without the support of a sturdy mount.
The Cutler Launcher is capable of firing an unguided, rocket-propelled grenade over short distances with startling efficiency. Its simple design allows for easy deployment and storage.
Used to construct Sandbag defenses.
Required to detonate Havoc Charges. The Havoc Charge must be placed before the detonator can be deployed.
This heavy-duty explosive device is designed to deal significant damage to fortified structures and stationary vehicles.
Legion scouts are deployed on the most dangerous missions. Their gear is lightweight, sturdy and well-suited for extended operations in rugged terrain.
The Warden army relies on outriders to provide and recieve vital intelligence. Their gear is sturdy and well-suited for extended operations in rugged terrain and inclement weather.
A container for shipping very large quantities of Crates using Crane loaded vehicles. This type of container can only be unloaded at Storage Depots and Seaports.
Standard ammunition for Shotguns.

A short-range firearm that has origins in both sport shooting and bird hunting. Its long stock and sturdy undercarriage give the Dragonfly stability and control that make it a worthy companion to many Kraunian soldiers deployed in urban centres. Dismantling haphazard barricades and clearing tight rooms are paltry tasks for the KRF1-750 Dragonfly.

A hunting shotgun with a sawn-off barrel for higher stopping power and mobility at the expense of accuracy. This traditional civilian firearm can fire two shots in rapid succession before needing to be reloaded. It became a favourite sidearm among Caoivish Watchers and has since earned quite an ominous reputation as a result.
A tool for digging Trenches and other entrenched structures.
A tool used to salvage components from remains of old vehicles and equipment.
Standard ammunition for submachine guns.

This classic submachine gun is sturdy and irreplacable as a general tool for close-range engagements. The Pitch Gun earned its namesake from Mesean sailors who employed the weapon to successfully defend against a night raid on the Geraston docks.
A heavier, modern variation of the Pitch Gun, the Lionclaw performs well as a decent, all-around submachine gun designed as a primary firearm in urban and close-quarters combat operations.
This unique, heavy-duty submachine gun is not very useful on the run, but with careful aim and adequate cover, becomes a razorblade in the night.
The Fiddler Submachine Gun is a widely used urban combat weapon. Its high rate of fire and compact frame make it ideal for close-quarters engagements.
A standard smoke grenade designed for concealing allied movement or screening the enemy’s vision.
Standard ammunition for sniper rifles.

A Kraunian rifle modified for long-range engagements. It doesn’t have the range or stopping power of other marksman rifles but more than makes up for it with unmatched reliability in a range of environments and a superior effective rate of fire.

A heavy-duty, long-range marksman rifle. The Clancy-Raca has one hell of a kick but is fitted with a powerful scope, allowing infantry to survey the battlefield and provide support from a safe location.
Unaccustomed to the cold, Legionaries must always adapt. This heavy topcoat is designed to mitigate the effects of cold while still allowing for optimal mobility and combat effectiveness.
Born and bred in the northern cold, this heavy parka protects Warden infantry from all but the worst blizzards.
A standard issue set of supplies for foot soldiers. Bases must be stockpiled with Soldier Supplies in order for players to spawn.
Standard issue infantry uniform for the Colonial Legion, designed for general frontline warfare with ballistics weapons such as rifles and machine guns.
Most common Warden infantry uniform, designed for general frontline warfare with ballistics weapons such as rifles and machine guns.
An adherable grenade designed to penetrate heavy tank armor. The Sticky Bomb can only be thrown a short distance and is ineffective against structures.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
High chance of disabling Track subsystem
Deals damage to vehicle armour

Description: Sulfur that can be refined into Heavy Explosive Powder at a Refinery
Standard-issue Mesean military dagger. Its long, slender blade excels in close-quarters combat as well as a plethora of uses in everyday operations.
A simple mine that is placed under terrain and fitted with a pressure-sensitive plate to detonate under the weight of heavy vehicles. Mines are visible to friendlies and enemies on foot.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Always disables the Track subsystem

Description: Nothing compares to the efficiency and destructive capabilities of the Colonial armour division. Tank crew are provided with sturdy coveralls and satchel belts for easy access to essential tools required for tank maintenance and operation.
Caoivish armour is unmatched in its design and resilience. All crew are provided with a sturdy boilersuit and satchel belts to access essential tools required for tank maintenance and operation.

Fired from submersible vessels, the Moray Torpedo is a self-propelled underwater missile that functions well at a variety of ranges and depths. It’s designed to bore into the hulls of large ships, leaving them vulnerable to leaks.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails: Increased chance to cause a leak.

Description: Used by medics to revive wounded soldiers.
A mount point for deployable infantry weapons and equipment.
An old war artillery shell that failed to detonate. Etchings on the side indicate a powerful payload and should be handled carefully.
Water... in a can!
A bucket that holds water. You can toss water onto fires to extinguish them.
Designed for underwater deployment, Sea Mines detonate upon contact with enemy vessels.

DamageType.DescriptionDetails:
Reduced damage against Trenches
Increased damage against Field Structures

Description: A sturdy fabric cylinder mounted on a tripod that’s designed to help nearby operators determine the speed and direction of wind.
Resource used for building advanced structures and producing special items.
A tool used to build structures and assemble materials.
A multipurpose tool. Can be used to dismantle mines/barbed wire and unlock vehicles.
Destroyed equipment reclaimed from the battlefield. Can be sorted into useful resources at a Refinery (using the right click context menu)
